hints.label: thm-lsi-implies-kl-convergence
hints.title: Exponential KL-Convergence via LSI
hints.content:
1487: :label: thm-lsi-implies-kl-convergence
1488: 
1489: If a Markov kernel $K$ with invariant measure $\pi$ satisfies a discrete-time LSI with constant $C_{\text{LSI}}$, then for any initial distribution $\mu_0$:
1490: 
1491: $$
1492: D_{\text{KL}}(\mu_t \| \pi) \le e^{-t/C_{\text{LSI}}} D_{\text{KL}}(\mu_0 \| \pi)
1493: $$

hints.label: thm-main-kl-final
hints.title: KL-Convergence of the Euclidean Gas (Main Result)
hints.content:
1524: :label: thm-main-kl-final
1525: 
1526: For the N-particle Euclidean Gas with parameters satisfying the Foster-Lyapunov conditions of Theorem 8.1 in [04_convergence.md](04_convergence.md), the Markov chain
1527: 
1528: $$
1529: S_{t+1} = \Psi_{\text{total}}(S_t) = (\Psi_{\text{kin}}(\tau) \circ \Psi_{\text{clone}})(S_t)
1530: $$
1531: 
1532: converges exponentially fast to the quasi-stationary distribution $\pi_{\text{QSD}}$ in relative entropy:
1533: 
1534: $$
1535: D_{\text{KL}}(\mu_t \| \pi_{\text{QSD}}) \le e^{-t/C_{\text{LSI}}} D_{\text{KL}}(\mu_0 \| \pi_{\text{QSD}})
1536: $$
1537: 
1538: with LSI constant:
1539: 
1540: $$
1541: C_{\text{LSI}} = O\left(\frac{1}{\min(\gamma, \kappa_{\text{conf}}) \cdot \kappa_x}\right)
1542: $$

hints.label: rem-kl-tv-comparison
hints.title: Relationship Between KL and TV Convergence Rates
hints.content:
1557: :label: rem-kl-tv-comparison
1558: 
1559: The Foster-Lyapunov proof establishes TV convergence with rate $\lambda_{\text{TV}}$. The KL convergence rate is:
1560: 
1561: $$
1562: \lambda_{\text{KL}} = \frac{1}{C_{\text{LSI}}} = \Theta(\gamma \kappa_{\text{conf}} \kappa_x)
1563: $$
1564: 
1565: **Relationship:**
1566: - KL-convergence **implies** TV-convergence via Pinsker's inequality: $\|P_t - \pi\|_{\text{TV}} \le \sqrt{D_{\text{KL}}(P_t \| \pi)/2}$
1567: - The rates may differ: typically $\lambda_{\text{KL}} \le \lambda_{\text{TV}}$ (KL is stronger, may be slower)
1568: - For this system, both are $O(\gamma \kappa_{\text{conf}})$, suggesting **matched rates**
1569: 
1570: **Additional information from KL-convergence:**
1571: - Gaussian tail bounds via Herbst argument
hints.raw_directive:
1554: ### 6.3. Comparison with Foster-Lyapunov Result
1555: 
1556: :::{prf:remark} Relationship Between KL and TV Convergence Rates
1557: :label: rem-kl-tv-comparison
1558: 
1559: The Foster-Lyapunov proof establishes TV convergence with rate $\lambda_{\text{TV}}$. The KL convergence rate is:
1560: 
1561: $$
1562: \lambda_{\text{KL}} = \frac{1}{C_{\text{LSI}}} = \Theta(\gamma \kappa_{\text{conf}} \kappa_x)
1563: $$
1564: 
1565: **Relationship:**
1566: - KL-convergence **implies** TV-convergence via Pinsker's inequality: $\|P_t - \pi\|_{\text{TV}} \le \sqrt{D_{\text{KL}}(P_t \| \pi)/2}$
1567: - The rates may differ: typically $\lambda_{\text{KL}} \le \lambda_{\text{TV}}$ (KL is stronger, may be slower)
1568: - For this system, both are $O(\gamma \kappa_{\text{conf}})$, suggesting **matched rates**
1569: 
1570: **Additional information from KL-convergence:**
1571: - Gaussian tail bounds via Herbst argument
1572: - Concentration of measure around the QSD
